Get Minimum and Maximum Dates from a Table

Source: R/db_utils.R
db_get_minmax_dates.Rd

This function queries a PostgreSQL database table to retrieve the minimum and maximum dates from a specified date column.

Usage

db_get_minmax_dates(con, table_name, date_column = "DATE")

Arguments

con

A database connection object created using DBI::dbConnect().

table_name

A character string specifying the name of the table to query.

date_column

A character string specifying the name of the date column. Defaults to "DATE".

Value

A data.table with two columns:

min_date

The earliest date in the specified column.

max_date

The latest date in the specified column.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Establish a connection to PostgreSQL
con <- DBI::dbConnect(
  RPostgres::Postgres(),
  dbname = "your_database",
  host = "your_host",
  port = 5432,
  user = "your_user",
  password = "your_password"
)

# Get the minimum and maximum dates from the table
result_dt <- db_get_minmax_dates(con, table_name = "TS01_entsoe_dam_prices", date_column = "DATE")
print(result_dt)

# Disconnect from the database
DBI::dbDisconnect(con)
} # }
